liable.translation[0].definitions[0].def: legally responsible for the cost of something
liable.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: people who are liable for income tax at a higher rate
liable.translation[0].definitions[1].def: likely to be affected by a particular kind of problem, illness etc
liable.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: You’re more liable to injury when you don’t get regular exercise.
liable.translation[0].definitions[2].def: likely to be legally punished or forced to do something by law
liable.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: Anyone found trespassing is liable to a maximum fine of $100.
liable.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: The troubled company will be liable for about $52 million in back taxes and penalties.
liable.translation[1].definitions[1].def: likely to be legally punished or forced to do something by law
liable.translation[1].definitions[1].exa: The firm admitted no wrongdoing and therefore they were not liable to anyone for the losses that had occurred.
The appeals court ruled that it would hold tobacco companies liable for illnesses related to smoking.
